engine_status: CONSISTENCY CONFIRMED -- Rotation engine passes internal consistency check. Wholesale Trade PARKED. Engine shifts to 80% execution support. Urgency elevated on Customer Support execution.
summary: Cycle 11 is the first Business Rotation Engine cycle. A systematic 6-channel scan of the US economy screened 42 candidates, quick-killed 25, parked 6, and killed 2 (Dental K-008, Consulting K-009). Zero new opportunities promoted to INVESTIGATE_FURTHER. Agent C characterizes this as 'strongest possible validation' of the pipeline. Agent B reclassifies: the rotation engine uses the same analytical framework that built the pipeline, so finding no better alternatives is a CONSISTENCY CHECK, not INDEPENDENT VALIDATION (P-012 pattern). Customer Support PURSUE maintained at 72 (flat). Veterinary INVESTIGATE_FURTHER maintained at 62 (Agent B reverses Agent C's +1 cross-channel validation -- same underlying data, not independent signal). Wholesale Trade PARKED by Agent B at 50 (down from 53) -- three cycles without customer discovery, PARK WARNING default triggered. The engine is now definitively in Phase 2 execution support mode. The most valuable rotation engine outputs were methodological: Baumol scanner bias identification, P-010 domain specificity refinement, three-layer framework validation (0% kill rescue rate), and failure archaeology confirming IO propagation chain entry sequence.

top_opportunities.name: Customer Support Vacuum Filler -- Managed Hybrid Human+AI
top_opportunities.thesis: AI-first managed customer support targeting SaaS mid-market (100-500 employees). AI handles 65% of tickets at near-zero marginal cost. LATAM human agents handle 35% complex/emotional escalations at 60% below US cost. Blended cost 60-67% below BPO incumbents. 40-55% gross margins. Service layer density confirmed <$500M (tool layer $5B+ saturated is distinct market). BPO incumbents structurally unable to invert (300K+ workforces, headcount contracts, management DNA). Triple convergence: Beveridge structural mismatch + staffing canary collapse + timing arbitrage. Failure archaeology (Zirtual) validates IO propagation chain entry sequence.
key_strengths: Service layer density RESOLVED: <$500M in AI-first managed services (SPARSE)
Triple convergence from 3 independent analytical lenses (strongest cross-signal in engine history)
Market-priced validation (RHI -51%, MAN -39% -- staffing canary confirms professional labor substitution)
BPO inversion barrier: 300K+ workforces cannot flip AI-first in 12-24 months (innovator's dilemma)
Unit economics: 40-55% gross margins, break-even at 8-12 clients
Founder fit: no credentials needed, LATAM agent pipeline, ML/AI capability
Rotation engine consistency check: no better alternative found in 42-candidate economy-wide scan
key_risks: Sierra AI ($200M+, $4.5B val) could pivot to managed mid-market (10-15% probability 12mo)
Timing window is 10-16 months and ERODING -- execution must begin immediately
Autonomous AI agents maturing could compress human escalation value (20-30% probability 12mo)
Quality/churn risk in SaaS mid-market (very experience-sensitive)
LATAM moat is temporary (6-12 months), not durable -- real moat is AI-first architecture
Hidden density from BPO incumbent AI adoption (indirect but real competition)
CAC may be 3x higher than modeled for unproven vendor (2-6 month sales cycles, not 2-4 weeks) -- NEW
SOC 2/GDPR compliance surface area for cross-border AI support -- NEW
LATAM agent retention in competitive market -- NEW
AI edge-case mishandling creates reputational risk to CLIENT companies -- NEW
top_opportunities.critical_action: BEGIN EXECUTION IMMEDIATELY. Build MVP AI support pipeline. Recruit 3-5 LATAM agents. Sign 2-3 pilot customers at $5K-10K/month. SOC 2 compliance assessment. First client within 90 days.
top_opportunities.vc_hook: The customer support market has a structural inversion problem: BPO firms have 300K+ employees and cannot flip to AI-first. AI agent startups sell tools, not managed service. We fill the gap -- AI-first managed support for SaaS mid-market at 60% below BPO cost. Market-priced validation: professional staffing stocks -51%. Triple convergence from independent analytical lenses. Service layer density <$500M despite tool layer saturation of $5B+.
top_opportunities.founder_competitive_advantage: Argentina founder provides LATAM talent pipeline for human agents at 60% below US cost. ML/AI founder builds the AI layer. Combined: AI-first + LATAM humans = lowest cost hybrid support provider. No credentials required. Speed advantage in LATAM recruiting.

top_opportunities.name: Veterinary Services -- Agentic Practice Operations
top_opportunities.thesis: AI-powered practice operations software for 33K independent vet practices. Legacy PIMS (Cornerstone, Avimark) are 15-20 years old. Archy ($47M) is lone modern entrant. Mars/IDEXX threat RESOLVED: Mars is acquisition-led (not software-building), IDEXX is diagnostics-focused (not practice ops). Competitive density remains sparsest in pipeline (<$100M in AI vet ops). Software-only model viable at $500K seed.
key_strengths: Sparsest competitive density in entire pipeline (<$100M in AI vet ops)
Mars/IDEXX threat RESOLVED: acquisition-led and diagnostics-focused respectively
Most states allow non-vet ownership (unlike dental 38-state restriction)
Legacy PIMS 15-20 years old -- ripe for replacement
key_risks: Archy ($47M) market position is CRITICAL UNKNOWN -- if >5% penetration, beachhead may be occupied
Small TAM ($297M at $750/month) limits VC attractiveness -- needs expanded pricing or adjacent markets
Mars/Archy acquisition risk UNDERPRICED at 20-30% within 24 months (Agent B updated from 15-25%)
Vet practice adoption is notoriously slow -- conservative market, high switching costs
No domain expertise on founding team -- needs advisor or hire
ANALYTICAL EXHAUSTION: 5 cycles without customer discovery. Hard deadline Cycle 13.
top_opportunities.critical_action: CUSTOMER DISCOVERY: Contact 5-10 vet practice owners. Validate willingness to pay. Assess Archy position. Recruit domain advisor. HARD DEADLINE: must begin by Cycle 13 or PARK.
top_opportunities.vc_hook: 33K fragmented vet practices with 60-70% labor costs and 15-20 year old software. Every other sector we scanned had $3B+ VC deployed -- vet has <$100M. Mars confirmed acquisition-led, not building software. We are the modern AI practice operating system.
top_opportunities.founder_competitive_advantage: ML/AI founder builds practice operations AI. Low regulatory barrier (most states allow non-vet ownership). Software-only model = capital-efficient at $500K-$1M. Needs vet domain advisor.

top_opportunities.name: Wholesale Trade AI Broker -- NAICS 425120 Disruption
top_opportunities.status: PARKED (Agent B Cycle 11 -- previously INVESTIGATE_FURTHER with PARK WARNING)
top_opportunities.thesis: AI-powered broker replacement for wholesale trade agents. Intellectually interesting Coasean thesis but unvalidated. Three cycles without customer discovery. Critical unknown (relationship stickiness) unresolvable by desk research.
key_risks: Relationship stickiness UNRESOLVED -- the critical unknown that determines viability
Knowde ($120M) is direct competitor in chosen vertical (commodity chemicals)
Three cycles without any customer discovery or market validation
Cold-start marketplace problem at $500K-$1M capital
top_opportunities.park_reason: Agent B PARK: three cycles at INVESTIGATE_FURTHER without customer discovery. PARK WARNING default triggered. Relationship stickiness question cannot be answered by desk research. Unpark only if customer discovery confirms transactional dynamics.
unpark_conditions: Customer discovery with 3-5 commodity chemical brokers confirming transactional dynamics
Knowde penetration confirmed <5% in target vertical
Founding team capacity freed to pursue this

key_patterns.description: Rotation engine's 42-candidate economy-wide scan found no better alternatives. Agent C: 'strongest validation.' Agent B: 'consistency check, not independent validation.' The engine's filters, applied broadly, select the same opportunities. This confirms internal coherence but not external validity. External validation requires customer discovery or revenue.

All 7 killed opportunities re-scanned through three-layer framework. Zero rescued. The framework correctly identifies sparse service layers ONLY where they genuinely exist. 0% false positive rate provides high confidence.

Beveridge structural mismatch + staffing canary equity collapse + timing arbitrage vacuum all independently converge on Customer Support. Now supplemented by failure archaeology (Zirtual validates IO propagation chain entry sequence).

BPO inversion barrier is DOMAIN-SPECIFIC to digital services. In physical operations, startups fail on unit economics before incumbent inversion barriers become relevant. P-010 applies to Customer Support but NOT to physical ops candidates.

Baumol channel's top picks are all quick-killed because high pay in tech/finance reflects talent competition, not cost disease. True Baumol stored energy requires credential-barrier intersection. Education, social work, and other low-wage sectors may be missed entirely.

Rotation engine quick-killed 25 of 42 candidates (60%) on density alone. The Universal Gate pattern extends beyond the pipeline to the full economy. Only 2 exceptions found across all scanning: customer support service layer and veterinary ops.

P3 Cost Collapse (100.0) and Capital Environment (100.0) sustained at maximum. Most favorable macro setup for AI-native business formation. Creative Destruction still stalled -- entrepreneurs NOT flooding in despite ideal conditions.
RHI -51%, MAN -39%, KELYA -20%. No recovery signal. Structural professional labor substitution continues. BLS/JOLTS validation expected Q2-Q3 2026.
